q: What is the difference between permanent and removable flood barriers?
a: Permanent systems stay fixed year-round; removable panels store off-season. Both use identical seals. Choice depends on aesthetics, space, and frequency of flooding.
Removable barriers cost 30 % less upfront. Permanent units require higher material cost but zero setup time.

q: Do permanent barriers affect curb appeal?
a: Minimal—low-profile thresholds and color-matched finishes hide them in plain sight. See architectural integration.

q: Can removable panels be deployed by one person?
a: Yes—lightweight aluminum panels average 18 lb per section and deploy in under 5 minutes per doorway.
Either, as long as documentation shows compliance with FEMA TB-3 and proper maintenance logs. See insurance benefits.
